snippet: A law went into effect Friday allowing German parents to register their newborn babies as neither male nor female if they were born with traits of both sexes.
abstract: German law goes into effect allowing parents to register their newborn babies as neither male nor female if they are born with traits of both sexes; law is intended to take pressure off parents to make hasty decision and possibly commit to surgery immediately after birth.
lead_paragraph: A law went into effect Friday allowing German parents to register their newborn babies as neither male nor female if they were born with traits of both sexes.

headline.main: Germany: A Third Option for the Sex of Babies
